column4: Why does wipe show a size of 14823232 on a 243 GB partition ? Isn't the number the size of the partition? There is a difference of factor 16384 - maybe block size or something ?
utility that can be used to wipe files, partitions or entire hdd
Can anyone confirm "wipe" is using 16 kb blocks ? I would like to be sure everything is fine. Can't find any documentation saying anything about it.
if you're worried, put something at the end of the disk and verify that it's gone after it runs
personally i think wipe is overkill unless you've got the NSA after you
it does seem to be empty - but I would like to be sure, since the hdd might be sold to someone else afterwards.
is that person an NSA agent?
anyway, just put something in that space before running wipe - either wipe will run properly on that region or it won't touch it at all
Random, but most likely not - but does that really matter? I don't want someone to be able to restore data that could contain passwords or other personal data.
I am not saying I want to run 42 wipes with different random write techniques, I just don't want to leave it simply reformatting the partition table.
just use dd if=/dev/zero of=disk
that's good enough for anyone who doesn't have an electron microscope
using if=/dev/urandom might be good enough even if they do - stuff like shred and wipe is for the super paranoid
from what I read shred/wipe simply overwrites the hdd with random bits. I guess doing a single such pass is not paranoid ?
well there are different degrees of paranoid - a single pass isn't that much more difficult than overwriting with zero, so it's not a big deal
but there are some people who insist on 25 of specific patterns and then multiple passes of randomness

agreed, I wasn't looking for random bit overwrite. Zero would have been ok. I don't use linux as my primary OS, so I just searched for a way to wipe a disk in linux (livecd), and found the "wipe" utility.
well the traditional way is dd if=/dev/zero of=disk
Great to know :)
oh and bs=1M - default dd block size is slow as all hell
The "wipe" completed hours ago - I guess it should be fine, right?
